snippet: New Yorkers trying to vote encountered long lines, jammed ballot scanners, poll sites that had run out of affidavit ballots and agitated, exhausted poll workers.
abstract: New Yorkers trying to vote encounter long lines, jammed ballot scanners, poll sites that had run out of affidavit ballots and agitated, exhausted poll workers; Board of Elections spokesperson says that Gov Cuomo's executive order allowing voters displaced by Hurricane Sandy to cast affidavit ballots at any polling site came too late to allow for adequate training of poll workers in how to interpret it.
lead_paragraph: New Yorkers trying to vote encountered long lines, jammed ballot scanners, poll sites that had run out of affidavit ballots and agitated, exhausted poll workers.

headline.seo: Chaos at New York City Polls Amid New Rules and Voting Machines
headline.main: Chaos at City’s Polls Amid New Voting Machines and Last-Minute Rules
headline.print_headline: Chaos at City’s Polls Amid New Voting Machines and Last-Minute Rules
